availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1859-1862

body.p: Personally appeared before me the undersigned a Justice of the Peace for Franklin County duly commissioned and acting as such under the Laws of Kentucky Jere Smith who made oath that he is the Keeper of the Kentucky Penitentiary; that George Woodruff a convict confined upon a judgment of the Jefferson Circuit Court and sentenced to five years imprisonment, escaped from said Prison on the 2nd of October 1860 and is now at large a Fugitive from the justice of this State, and is as he believes & is informed now in the state of Louisiana.
Given under my hand this 22 day of November 1860.

J W South Keeper
of Ky Penitentiary

Sworn to by SJere Smith this 22 Nov 1860
Geo W. Gorin J. P.
Franklin County Ky

Louisiana
Demand for George Woodruff
convict
Issd Nov 22d. 1860
